meanings.definition: A person or thing that coils.
meanings.sent1: The coiler neatly wound the rope around the pole.
meanings.sent2: The machine acted as a coiler, twisting the wires together.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten turned into a coiler, wrapping itself in yarn.
meanings.sent4: The vines in the garden resembled a coiler, twisting and turning around the fence.
meanings.sent5: The coiler at the factory worked tirelessly, rolling up the metal sheets.

meanings.definition: A device used for coiling or winding.
meanings.sent1: The automatic coiler neatly wrapped the cable for storage.
meanings.sent2: The old coiler in the workshop helped with organizing the hoses.
meanings.sent3: The coiler in the garage decided to take a break and coil up for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The coiler on the fishing rod smoothly wound the line back in after casting.
meanings.sent5: The coiler on the spool kept the thread neatly wound and ready for sewing.

meanings.definition: A snake that coils its body.
meanings.sent1: The coiler in the grass startled the hikers as it slithered away.
meanings.sent2: The coiler in the exhibit at the zoo fascinated the visitors with its movements.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous coiler in the garden liked to play hide and seek with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The coiler in the tree branch looked like a spiral staircase, coiled and ready to strike.
meanings.sent5: The coiler in the sand pit coiled around its prey, ready to strike at any moment.
